summary: This document is an internal FBI communication from 2019 regarding a follow-up on a former employee of Jeffrey Epstein from the 1990s. It references a 1996 complaint and a 2006 interview that could not be located, and mentions allegations against Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell by the woman's younger sister. The FBI directs the inquiring attorney to use the FOIA process.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as 'E in's' (likely Epstein's). The document states a woman 'cuddled' with him in the 1990s.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as 'Maxwell'. Allegedly rubbed a woman's breasts during a massage in the 1990s.

persons.name: Austin
persons.context: An FBI agent for whom travel authority was requested to interview a subject's sister in North Carolina.

connections.description: Both are named in allegations of sexual misconduct from the 1990s involving the same victim.
Agent Austin was involved in the investigation, with travel authorized to interview a witness related to Epstein.

events.title: Alleged Abuse Incident
events.description: A woman (the younger sister of a former Epstein employee) stated she went to Epstein and 'cuddled' with him, and Maxwell allegedly rubbed her breasts during a massage.

events.title: Reported Complaint
events.description: A complaint was reportedly made in 1996, but the FBI could not locate any documentation of it.

events.title: FBI Interview
events.description: The younger sister of a former Epstein employee was interviewed by the FBI in 2006 as part of an investigation (the 'MM case', likely referring to Ghislaine Maxwell).

events.title: FBI Follow-up on Records Request
events.description: The FBI followed up on an attorney's request for documentation regarding a 1996 complaint and 2006 interview, concluding no records were found and directing the attorney to FOIA.

keyFacts: The FBI could not locate any documentation of a 1996 complaint or a 2006 interview 302 related to a former Epstein employee.
A 2006 FBI interview with the employee's younger sister revealed allegations that in the 1990s, she 'cuddled' with Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell allegedly rubbed her breasts during a massage.
The FBI concluded that any victimization was likely outside the statute of limitations, and neither the sister nor the employee were pursued further.
The communication directs an attorney to seek documentation through the official FOIA process, noting it would be the responsibility of the FBI's Miami field office.
